meanings.sent1: After the ceremony, the priest reanointed the newborn baby with holy oil.
meanings.sent2: The king decided to reanoint his loyal advisor as the head of the royal council.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally reanointed the same dish twice, making it extra flavorful!
meanings.sent4: The artist felt like she needed to reanoint her paintbrush to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully reanointed the wilted plants, hoping they would thrive once more.

meanings.definition: To consecrate or make sacred again.
meanings.sent1: The ancient temple was reanointed by the high priest during the annual ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The sacred relic was reanointed by the elders to restore its spiritual power.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children decided to reanoint their secret hideout as a forbidden temple.
meanings.sent4: The old library was reanointed with new books, breathing life into its dusty shelves.
meanings.sent5: The mystical amulet was reanointed under the full moon to enhance its magical properties.
